LEADING GLOBAL PROVIDER OF CLOUD-BASED INSURANCE SOFTWARE

EMPLOYEES
tigerlab currently has 35+ employees across Europe and Asia.
OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADVANCEMENT
We are a fast-growing company that offers career opportunities, and not just “another job”.

Managing the analytics for day-to-day outlet operations and performance in Malaysia.
Manage daily data collection by analysts, insights and reporting across regions’ KPIs.
Support the General Manager with strategies and tactics to achieve KPIs and problem-solve with matters such as operating expenses, recruitment and manpower planning.

4 to 8 years of working experience. Startup/F&B background will be advantageous.
Builder & hustler: you challenge existing "best practices" and build the new industry standard. On past projects you have demonstrated the ability to get your hands dirty and to be highly resourceful.
Problem-solver (analytical & data driven): you are great with people and equally great with numbers to help make business decisions (SQL will be a big bonus).
Biased to action + master in prioritizing: you always focus on tackling the biggest challenges first (both short & long term) without getting distracted with nice-to-haves.
Crystal clear communicator: both spoken and written (languages required: English & Malay).

Finology, a FinTech & InsurTech company in Kuala Lumpur (Malaysia), is looking for Business Analysts (fresh graduates and experienced candidates) to join our fast-paced yet rigorous IT Delivery Team.
Do you enjoy solving problems that will serve thousands of people? Are you experimental yet pragmatic in problem solving? Do you consider yourself to be a strong communicator? If yes, this role might be for you!
What you'll be working on:
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to identify software requirements for both existing and new projects
Work with Software Engineers to turn software requirements into industry-standard software solutions
Manage various aspects of software development, ensuring quality and timely delivery of projects
Create and maintain relevant documentations
Perform internal Quality Assurance (QA) activities
Manage System Integration Test (SIT) and User Acceptance Test (UAT) activities with internal and external stakeholders
What we'd like to see in the candidate:
Analytical Thinking. You are able to break down complex problems into smaller parts, solve them, and bring them back together to form a holistic solution.
End Users x Business Objectives. You always keep the end users in mind but understand that different voices within the organization contribute to final outcomes.
Consistency x Flexibility. You are an organised person who enjoys creating and documenting processes. At the same time, you allow a certain degree of flexibility to ensure that objectives can be met in a timely manner.
Industry Experience. Professional experience in banking and/or insurance is a plus point.
Apply Now
Are you up for the challenge?

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

About Standard Chartered
We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 160 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents. And we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.

Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion. Together we:
Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do


Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well


Be better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term
In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.
Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations


Time-off including annual, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 weeks maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum


Flexible working options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns


Proactive wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills, global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits


A continuous learning culture to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning


Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation, one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.
Recruitment assessments - some of our roles use assessments to help us understand how suitable you are for the role you've applied to. If you are invited to take an assessment, this is great news. It means your application has progressed to an important stage of our recruitment process.

Role Responsibilities
Overview:
ICS TRP is a critical portfolio Standard Chartered Bank operating under the overall purview of “Trust, Data & Resilience” in the COO organisation. The ICS TRP is made up of Programme Managers, Project Managers, Business Analysts, Architects, Engineers and Testers, who are accountable designing and delivering cyber security capabilities to maintain and continuously improve Bank’s cyber security posture in today’s ever-evolving cyber security landscape. While the overall ICS TRP Portfolio is transitioning into the New Ways of Working [NWoW], this specific role will be built from the outset in that context and apply all the principles/concepts/terminology specified in the NWoW.
Scope of Role:
The Security Business Analyst will be an interface between technology teams, support teams, and business partners to identify and define solutions to maximize the value delivered by an organization to its stakeholders. Business Analysts work across all levels of an organization and participate in defining the goals and requirements for programs and projects or supporting continuous improvement in its technology and processes.
Determines the overall requirements gathering strategy and plans the requirements phase of the project – produce the Solution Design Document.
Acts as the liaison among the stakeholders to elicit, analyze, document, communicate and validate business and system requirements using industry leading practices within the business analyst profession. Ensures all requirements are fulfilled and facilitated by the sprint goals of the agile teams. Produce/Reviews the Solution Design Document and any other project related artefacts that aligns with the Squads standards, NWoW requirements and any other activities that supports agile delivery.
Key Stakeholders
ICS-TRP
Cyber Security Services
Security Technology Services
Chief Information Security Office
Key Business Stakeholders including: All Business and Function

Other Responsibilities
Support the Agile team to ensure delivery of Project Objectives and Security Team governance, risk and compliance objectives
Single point of contact for planning and drive the operations readiness to adopt the new solutions/deliverables and assessment activities
Experienced in managing Infrastructure, Security tools & business process requirements
Produce and obtain signoffs for all the required project documentation to comply with the Banks requirements.
Experience with Business Operations and Process documentation and requirements gathering
Experience working both independently and a team oriented, collaborative environment
Track multiple potential deficiencies as identified in assessments until resolution is sufficiently demonstrated
Successfully engage in multiple security governance adherence initiatives simultaneously
Perform subject matter expert role for audit and compliance requirements of the project.
Develop and deliver progress and remediation reports and presentations as directed by Security Team leadership
Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and security management practices by adhering to required standards and processes
Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment. - A strong & assertive communicator in speaking & writing.
Recognize complex problems, analyze situations and provide suggested/implemented resolution(s)
Ability to interact professionally with a diverse group including executives, managers and subject matter experts
Ability to apply critical thinking to control and business risk interpretations on behalf of the Cyber Security Team and clearly articulate
Our Ideal Candidate
SCRUM, AGILE, Industry recognized audit and assessment certification is preferred (e.g. CISA, CRISC, QSA, etc.) and Business Analysts certification.
Industry recognized network or cyber security certification is preferred (e.g. CISSP, CISM, SANS, etc.)
ROLE SPECIFIC TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES
Proficiency in the MS Office suite, including Excel, PowerPoint, Word
Proficiency with MS Project or equivalent
Proficiency with Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN) 2.0
Proficiency with documented business processes
Familiarity with IT Infrastructure Library (ITIL) processes

The business analyst is responsible for analyzing and modeling existing business processes. The goal of business process analysis is to understand and document current business procedures and identify areas for improvement. A thorough understanding of the current state of the organization is necessary prior to recommending changes related to implementing a new business solution. The business analyst uses modeling tools to document the current state of business processes as well as the desired future state. The business analyst is responsible for the knowledge transfer of business implications to the application/database developers and project managers.
Key Accountabilities
Business Requirements finalization and defining the scope of the project
Gap Analysis
Solution Design: Propose solutions based on business requirements and work with Developers/Testers to implement the solution
Support the team during the Unit Testing, SIT and UAT
Quality Management: Ensures that all tasks carried out comply with procedures, mandatory quality standards and agreed testing standards and strategy Supervisory responsibilities:
Work with a team of BA outside project work
Mentoring Junior BA within the team
Key clients (internal and external)
Job Duties & responsibilities
Performs feasibility analysis, scope identification for projects, and works with the project management team to prioritizes deliverables, and negotiate on product functionalities.
Extract the AS-IS processes from the business users and work the business requirements with the customer business users
Analyse the AS-IS Scenarios and design the TO-BE business process flow with the Solution Architect
Working with Solution Architect during the design and blueprinting phases
Working with the business team for business use case development
Review the details of Business Requirement Document (BRD) and translate it into functional specifications.
Provides analytic support by coordinating data extraction from various databases and data interpretation.
Ensure that right practices are being followed while documenting requirements, by putting governance in place across different business domains. Review the requirement documents generated by team and suggest changes required if any.
Partners with development and analytic teams to provide reporting on software solutions.
Participates in Integration Testing and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality Testing. Required Experience (Indicate nature and extent of work experience including minimum number of years required.)
At least 8-10 years of working experience in IT industry with proven experience in eliciting requirements and testing
At least 2-3 years working experience in digital banking domain
Strong analytical and logical reasoning skills.
Familiarity with key core banking technologies
Experience with SQL, Webservices, Sharepoint, Jira and Confluence
Candidate with operational experience and technical background, will have an advantage.
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)

The Product

GTHE has been launched in 20 countries and is being continually enhanced to serve physicians and patients worldwide, making it possible for all patients to get the care they need within 15 minutes. Our mission is to make GHTE the #1 choice telehealth solution globally for patients and physicians within the next 3 years

Company overview
This is a great opportunity to join a well-established Retail & Consumer Goods Group that is a strong player in its industry and has a strong presence in Asia. They are looking to bring on board a dynamic business analyst to join their team in the midst of their expansion plan.

Reporting to the Finance Manager, the key responsibilities for this role will be focusing on the data analysis for the Commercial department, mostly towards sales revenue from the different parts of business. Job_Description:
ZALORA Malaysia is searching for an Operational Excellence Business Analyst to join the regional Operational Excellence team. Currently, this team consists of two work streams: a company-wide Continuous Improvement Program and Business Excellence. We are a small and mighty team, so your tasks in the beginning may vary, though eventually you will be mainly (70- 80%) working under the Business Excellence (BE) workstream that is uniquely positioned to work cross-functionally across the organization.
BE aims to push ZALORA more towards customer-centricity, looks for ways to be sustainably scalable and supports initiatives that pushes growth and profitability. The ideal candidate will possess an analytical mindset— able to glean insights from complex data sets and ask perceptive questions— and be entrepreneurial, not afraid to hit the ground running and work proactively. Because we are a small team looking to grow, the ideal candidate must be comfortable working independently.
Responsibilities:
Support and even lead quantitative and qualitative analysis on projects and know how to simplify the meaning of the findings
Support the team and even lead personal projects that can range from Revenue, Sustainability to Operations that focus on optimizing a process, KPI or driving a new initiative
Good project management abilities to keep initiatives organized and going with good cadence
Comfortable talking and presenting to middle and upper management where necessary
Excellent communication and teamwork skills, as you will be collaborating with many teams and individuals and keeping all aligned
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in STEM subjects or other relevant field of study (Business, Economics, etc), though all degrees are welcome to apply
Preferably have 1 year of working experience in management consulting or high-growth technology company
Proficiency in Excel and SQL
Comfortable with both numbers and writing/communication
Logical, process-driven mindset, able to break problems down to its atomic parts
Able to both think from a strategic perspective and execute down to the operational details
What We Offer You:
A chance to see your impact in the organization as we highly encourage ownership as an organization
An opportunity to be certified with Lean Six Sigma (up to Green or Black Belt) or project management certifications in this role
Driven colleagues and a diverse and multicultural work environment
ZALORA was recently awarded with an HRD Asia Award in 2021 for Best Employer (>1000 Employees)

The Zalora Story
ZALORA is Asia’s leading online fashion, beauty and lifestyle destination, part of Global Fashion Group. As one of the region’s pioneer large scale ecommerce platforms, ZALORA has established a strong presence throughout the region, particularly in Singapore, Indonesia, Malaysia, Brunei, the Philippines, Hong Kong, and in Taiwan, enjoying over 50 million visits per month.

Carousell is looking for a Business Analyst in our next phase of growth, to inspire the world to start selling, to make more possible for each other. Carousell is one of the world's largest and fastest growing classifieds marketplace, with a user base of more than 40 million and valued at over US$900m backed by leading investors, including Telenor Group, Rakuten Ventures, Naver, and Sequoia Capital. We aim to reinvent classifieds by removing the barriers to selling and buying, being smart, personalised, transactional, and based on the community. This role will report to the Country Head of Carousell Malaysia.

WHAT YOU WILL DO
Carousell Malaysia is looking for a passionate candidate where you'll be diving deep into marketing and consumer data to uncover insights so as to help us better understand consumer behaviours, and feed that into action plans to drive business decisions for growth & monetization.
You'll be the voice of the consumers in the org through measuring and analysing data from internal and external sources, applying this knowledge to cross-functional teams and uplevelling the org's knowledge of their consumer by suggesting the right tools and sources of data.
Reporting directly to the Country Head of Carousell Malaysia, the business analyst is responsible for the following:
Proactively understand business needs/requirements and translate data into insights for informed business decisions and strategic planning to grow and improve the business
Work with key business stakeholders and data team (data analysts, data engineers, machine learning engineers) to develop insights, prepare reports and data visualization, and assist in predictive models to solve important business problems and capitalise on opportunities
Perform pricing analysis and deep dive analysis (not limited to internal data) to support business growth; includes troubleshooting potential problems, identifying root causes and proposing solutions and improvements.
Research and create detailed business proposals; outlining problems and opportunities, perform in-depth analysis and provide recommendations to management for decision making purposes.
Improving the way we measure efforts to acquire users, and help improve the user journey
Monitor user voice and obtain user-related insights from user tickets. Own and have knowledge of all user-facing matters related to the Malaysian market
Analyze competition and global trends, and develop implications and recommendations on how Carousell should respond or move forward. Requires collaboration with HQ Strategy.
Work with key stakeholders to shape strategy on key goods categories in Malaysia
Work with relevant teams in the localisation of execution based on insights from internal & external data
Coordinate and where necessary, conduct quantitative and qualitative benchmarking with peers, internal markets, research and analysis to form strategic choices.
Conduct QA sampling for content moderation accuracy and violations
Investigating and responding to escalations relating to user issues
REQUIREMENTS
1 to 3 years of working experience in Business Consulting.
A Hustler. Able to work with ambiguity, always ready to pivot and roll with changes common in the org, independently.
A Self-starter. Will take charge to own and drive projects when lines are not clearly defined
A diligent candidate with the ability to follow-up and work with key stakeholders to shape the business outcome.
Good communicator. A person who is able to communicate well and collect information from different stakeholders
Strong in quantitative & qualitative analysis
Experience with data analytics is an added advantage


Note: Only shortlisted will be notified.
Agencies: Please do not call or email any employee of Carousell Group outside of the Talent Acquisition team. Agencies must have a valid fee agreement in place and they must have been assigned the specific requisition to which they submit resumes, to the Talent Acquisition team. Introduction
Are you looking for a career that will allow you to use your unique blend of business acumen and tech savvy? Business Analysts at IBM are subject matter experts that build the bridge between our business and our clients, immersing themselves into the market to understand problems and find innovative solutions. Be ready to navigate the complex relationships that make the business world run and find the actionable insights that result in great business decisions.

Your Role and Responsibilities
Business analysts act as the interpreters between the worlds of IT and business. Typical examples of the deliverables are functional and non-functional requirements, use-cases, process models, and impact analysis. Focuses on Individual/Team Objectives and Developing Professional Effectiveness. Skills:

Roles and Responsibilities:
1. Working closely with the users to understand business goals / business outcomes of a require Cloud solution / features. Discover, assess, organize, and clarify business needs.
2. Work with the larger IBM team to propose a solution.
Analyze the impact of proposed changes.
Document and support communications between IT teams and stakeholders.
Internal / External Team Collaboration
Work with the System Analysts and other technical teams to ensure that they understand the specifications.
Collaborates with our vendors to ensure they understand the specifications.
Collaborate with System Analyst, Project Manager, and other IT Teams
3. Adopt Agile methodology and tools (write user stories, prioritize with users backlogs, define detailed user specifications and work with scrum team in designing the solution and delivering the propose solution etc)
4. Drive all user sessions

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
2 - 3 years experience in similar role.
Industry knowledge in Oil and Gas - Upstream or experience with Cloud Web / Mobile App implementations will be an advantage.
Preferably with certification in Scrum (e.g. SAFe scrum master certification). Strong sense of ownership and good interpersonal skills.
Client Centric - Candidate must possess strong project and vendor management skills and proven ability in project delivery. Strong technical skills in developing cloud web/ mobile apps and understanding of instruments will be an added advantage.
Forward thinking, growth-mindset and resourceful to ensure solutions are brought to fruition and requirements are closed properly.
Good decision-making skills and response to high-pressure situations.
Able to collaborate and work effectively with multiple teams with varying skillsets.
Strong written and communication skills.
Candidates with local language is important as engagement with users requires local language comprehension.

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
N/A

About Business Unit
IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.

Your Life @ IBM
Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Job_Title: Business Planning Analyst, Solv Venture - SC Ventures
Job_Description:
Job: Business Support and Management
Primary Location: Asia-Malaysia-Kuala Lumpur
Schedule: Full-time
Employee Status: Permanent
Posting Date: 16/Mar/2022, 1:29:54 AM
Unposting Date: 15/Apr/2022, 5:59:00 PM

About the Venture
Solv Malaysia (the “Venture”) is a newly formed SCV-backed entity creating a digital Business to Business (“B2B”) e-commerce marketplace that will address growth challenges for the micro, small and medium sized businesses (“MSMEs”) in Malaysia while linking them to local and global supply chains.
The platform will help MSMEs grow their business by connecting verified buyers and sellers, facilitating them for quick and easy access to finance; as well as taking advantage of affordable and reliable business services to meet the pain points of the MSMEs in Malaysia.

About the role
The Business Planning Analyst for the Venture will assist all operations and ensure business processes are set up in a sustainable and agile way to support the Venture in all phases from product development, go-live, run and expansion. You will assist with providing business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution.
This is a rare opportunity for a self-driven, strong entrepreneurial spirit, start-up minded, solid and passionate leader to participate and contribute to a venture.
Responsibilities
Overall
Project planning, execution, follow ups
Interface with relevant stakeholders to overcome obstacles to implementation
Lead with the preparation and communication of high-quality and timely submissions of materials for the Venture to internal stakeholders and external clients
Assist in the budgeting and financial analysis for the Venture
Assist in managing various projects and initiatives and undertake ad hoc thematic work for the Venture Lead / CEO and the Operations Lead / COO
Assist in developing overall business strategies of the Venture
Set up governance cadence and assist with regular senior management and board meetings and ad hoc meetings including any follow up actions
Develop efficient business processes to support the growing business.
Take active lead regarding set-up of risk management framework, policies and standards
Perform any other tasks assigned by the Venture Lead / CEO and Operations Lead / COO
Stakeholder Management
Effectively engage Solv Malaysia and SCV stakeholders across functions
Strong communication skills, ability to tailor ideas to required audience and stakeholders
Possess a driven, can-do attitude and proactive in supporting stakeholder engagement
Comfortable in working with multiple stakeholders’ teams and functions
Build strong and effective relationships with the various technology and business counterparts
Some experience in co-ordination of multiple dependencies and stakeholders in complex, large scale deployment environments
People and Talent
Lead by example and assist in building the appropriate culture and values
Create a motivational and challenging environment in the team which is conducive to creativity and delivery of the strategy
Governance
Act and escalate quickly when any risk and control weakness become apparent and ensure they are addressed within an appropriate timeframe and escalated through the relevant committees
Work with multiple stakeholders to establish applicable risk / control framework to ensure that the Group’s ability to remain within risk appetite is not materially threatened
Familiarise self with governance structures and mandatory bank processes
Regulatory & Business Conduct
Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s as well as Solv’ Values and Code of Conduct

About SC Ventures

About the Venture
Solv Malaysia (the “Venture”) is a newly formed SCV-backed entity creating a digital Business to Business (“B2B”) e-commerce marketplace that will address growth challenges for the micro, small and medium sized businesses (“MSMEs”) in Malaysia while linking them to local and global supply chains.
The platform will help MSMEs grow their business by connecting verified buyers and sellers, facilitating them for quick and easy access to finance; as well as taking advantage of affordable and reliable business services to meet the pain points of the MSMEs in Malaysia.

About the role
The Business Planning Analyst for the Venture will assist all operations and ensure business processes are set up in a sustainable and agile way to support the Venture in all phases from product development, go-live, run and expansion. You will assist with providing business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution.
This is a rare opportunity for a self-driven, strong entrepreneurial spirit, start-up minded, solid and passionate leader to participate and contribute to a venture.

Vacancy information
OVERVIEW OF ROLE

Applications are sought for position of GPC&AP Market Analyst and Business Planner (MABP) to be based in Kuala Lumpur (Malaysia). The MABP is responsible for supporting the acquisition of new business for the GPC&AP region through the gathering, analysis and presentation of market intelligence to enable strategic business planning.

The MABP shall administer the Client Relationship Management database, support periodic planning and reporting activities whilst being a proactive participant of the overall Sales & Marketing organisation.

The position reports to the GPC&AP Sales & Marketing Director.

Specific Key Responsibilities & Activities

Continuously monitor market intelligence sources (industry press, client releases and subscription services…), analyse the data for market trends, client and competitor activities that impact on the regions strategy, and prepare reports and presentations to support business decisions.
Provide support to the Business Development team with pursuits, reporting of client interactions and maintaining the client relationship database.
Provide input to the group and the region’s periodic reporting requirements by ensuring alignment and updates to vessel schedules, resource plans and master commercial plans.
Provide support to the Five-Year Plan and Annual Budget processes and maintain the region’s Master Commercial Plan ensuring close alignment between Finance and Human Resources.
Perform market analysis and studies to support regional business plans and wider group strategic plans for traditional Oil & Gas markets but also the emerging market of Floating Wind and other Energy Transition opportunities in the Asia Pacific region.
Support Human Resources for resource planning against forward looking scenarios to support proactive resource management and recruitment.

KEY RELATIONSHIPS/ STAKEHOLDERS

External
Clients and market intelligence providers


Internal
GPC&AP Vice Presidents (GPC&AP & Australia)
GPC&AP Sales and Marketing Director / Australia Sales & Marketing Director
GPC&AP Asia General Manager
GPC&AP Directors (Finance, HR, SCM…)
Business Development Managers
Corporate Sales & Marketing Snr Vice President and wider team
GPC&AP Tendering team
Field Development Group


PERSON SPECIFICATION

We are recruiting for a highly motivated, analytical and industry-aware person to join our team and to help shape the future direction of the GPC&AP region. The role requires collaborative working with a number of stakeholders, but also the ability to work effectively with sole responsibility.

As a member of the Sales & Marketing team for the Global Projects Centre and Asia Pacific the MABP is afforded a unique global view of our clients and markets, providing key insights to support the region’s and wider group’s strategic plans.

The successful candidates shall:

Operate with the highest standards of integrity, preserving the confidentiality of the information available with the role.
Maintain a comprehensive awareness of the Offshore Energy and Subsea industry, Subsea7’s position in the market and our competitors and the emerging new markets associated with the Energy Transition.
Work collaboratively within a multi-national, multi-location team.
Be able to prepare high quality/accuracy, engaging presentations and reports, suitable for a senior audience review.
Be motivated to continue to learn and support the region and groups growth plans and evolution through the Energy Transition.
Possess a comprehensive understanding of all common business software applications (Microsoft suite) and be able to quickly learn and maximise the value from new applications.

Job Description:
About Bank of America
Our purpose as a firm is to make financial lives better, through the power of every connection. Across the world, we partner with leading corporate and institutional investors through our offices in more than 35 countries. In the U.S. alone, we serve almost all of the Fortune 500 companies and approximately 67 million consumer and small-business clients. We provide a full suite of financial products and services, from banking and investments to asset and risk management. We cover a broad range of asset classes, making us a global leader in corporate and investment banking, sales and trading.
Connecting Asia Pacific to the world
Our Asia Pacific team is spread across 19 cities in 12 markets. We are focused on connecting Asia to the world and the world to Asia, using our global expertise to ensure success is shared between us, our clients and our communities. Our regional footprint covers 12 currencies, more than a dozen languages and five time zones, placing us firmly among the region’s leading financial services companies.

Possess superior valuation / financial analysis skills and proficient in financial modelling
High level of focus on work quality and attention to detail, and ability to perform under pressure and tight deadlines

Summary
The CDD (CUSTOMER DUE DILIGENCE) Process Assurance Analyst role is to run the process assurance and reporting activities for those activities supported by GBS with the aim to provide process assurance and reporting of CDD and Pre-Qualification to the Head of CDD and the respective head of controls for each segment. The CDD Process Assurance Analyst will be acting as maintainer of the CDD Deskbook and Tools ; and ensure that necessary updates are being made to ensure that the procedure / policy defined by Company group supported by GBS is being met. The role is to also be responsible for producing the reporting required for both for internal CDD team and externally to stakeholders. This role will lead the process improvement and changes to Group procedure that have impact to GBS CDD Operations. Also responsible for the knowledge management and retention.
Key Accountabilities
Process Leadership
Support the necessary updates to the end to end process (including tools) to support changes in Group procedure and risks management activities
Support the development of CDD and Pre-Qualification capability into the team within the centre, by supporting the coordination of the capabilities assessment and training requirements
Support business growth agenda and strategic initiatives in line with CDD risk management requirements
Ensure counterparty data integrity in the systems is preserved and enhanced in line with CDD policy and procedures.
Drive continuous improvement and efficiency agenda to CDD processes across the centres.
Support the control and user access on the CDD platform
Support controls activities for CDD tools & Procedure.
Support the management of CDD tools (Aravo, WC1, DNB, Transparint, Lloyds, Seaweb) and support the engagement with the tool service providers ; including managing the contract renewal and service level adherence.
Support knowledge management and retention (including SOP review and update)
Support closure of audit actions (both internal and business audit action)
Process and Data Integrity
Ensure all information are stored securely in accordance with the requirements of the CDD process ensuring compliance with any data privacy requirements
Participate in counterparty database review project for data cleanliness

Job Purpose and Impact

The Sales Force Business Analyst will be responsible for executing complex sales enablement strategies. In this role, you will develop and deploy complex processes and change management to ensure the adoption of sales enabling tools. You will serve as a partner in developing and sustaining complex solutions that make our sales teams more effective and efficient through a mix of tools, processes and technologies. You will be involved in continuous improvement, sales training, sales processes, sales tools adoption and event management to enable increased internal and external engagement and effectiveness for our sales organization. Drive the salesforce (LEAP) usage & adoption in APAC region by solving technical challenges & process mapping Provide ad hoc, just in time commercial presentation support, including developing and editing presentation documents to professional quality for team and leadership. Discuss with business super users/CRM tags and sales operations about their requirements for CRM(Salesforce) enhancements. Act as Super user/SME for CE team. Provide ad-hoc supports for business super users/CRM tags if they cannot handle complicated issues Coordinate content curation initiatives with key business partners to deliver both internal and external insights related to market, industry and consumer trends. Lead CRM(Salesforce) related projects and enhancements within APAC and propose solutions for businesses Provide end to end ownership of the processes or future tools in the commercial environment, including effectiveness and utilization measures, such as the account planning process and customer segmentation. Work with business super users/CRM tags to prepare and organize UATs for each project/enhancement Collaborate with business process owners to implement and support process design and metrics for optimal execution and results. Drive to build correct digitalized business processes in CRM(Salesforce) to make sure these processes are aligned with the global standard ones. (Minimize business localizations) Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating only the most complex issues to appropriate staff. Primary Objective:

Conduct detailed equity research in order to provide long-term investment and short-term trading ideas to Institutional Equities and Retail Securities sales teams, and effectively support Group Investment Banking efforts to generate revenue.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Meet requests from Institutional Equities sales teams and clients, and provide strong research support to Group Wholesale Banking and Group Investment Banking revenue pillars.
2. Cover sectors in the home country, as assigned:
Active monitoring of the micro and macro factors affecting the sector(s).
Regularly visit companies and organisations related to the sector(s).
Generate investment ideas on sectors/stocks including identifying sales/trading opportunities.
Write research reports on these investment ideas in a timely manner.
Consistently update Institutional clients on the latest development in the sector(s).
Assist in production/coordination of research publications and organisation of conferences.
3. Accompany a Head of Research or Head, Regional Sector in marketing roadshows and other client servicing efforts in the home country as well as overseas markets, as assigned.

4. Research Analysts, subject to performance, may be given an enlarged role with additional responsibilities to:
Cover companies outside of the home country as part of a regional sector team.
Participate, and potentially take a leading role, in a multi-sector thematic research project that includes other research analysts in the team.
5. All analysts must:
Display teamwork to achieve a coherent research product.
Work closely with other Board Members and other senior management personnel at all times to develop RHB’s research product and brand.
Ensure compliance of all legal and regulatory requirements to achieve a high standard of integrity for RHB’s research team and product.

Key Shared Accountabilities
Assist RHB Investment Bank in evaluation potential initial public offerings and corporate deals.
Collaborate with related departments in Group Investment Banking, including ECM, Corporate Finance, and Corporate Client Coverage teams.
Support and collaborate with Group Research departments, including Economic Research and Fixed Income, Currencies and Rates Research.

About Accenture
Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centres. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.
About Capability Network:
Part of Strategy & Consulting, the Capability Network is a global distributed management consulting organization that provides management consulting and strategy expertise across the client lifecycle. Approximately 3,600 consultants are part of this rapidly expanding network, providing specialized and strategic industry and functional consulting expertise from key locations around the world. Our Capability Network teams complement Accenture’s in-country teams to deliver cutting-edge expertise and measurable value to clients all around the world. For more information, visit www.accenture.com/capabilitynetwork.
Practice Overview:
The Customer Sales & Service functional team is aligned to the Capability Network division of Accenture and works with clients across its marketing, sales, and services department. The team provides transformation services across three key offerings: Marketing Transformation, Connected Commerce and Next-Generation Customer Care. These services help our clients become living businesses by optimizing their marketing and sales strategies and thereby optimizing their cost to serve, thus improving revenue per customer.
The team is comprised of individuals who have an in-depth understanding of marketing, sales and services functions and experience across various industries like Communications and High Tech, Banking, Insurance, Energy, Utilities and Retail.
We are looking for passionate and driven individuals who will help define marketing and campaign strategies, design and implement Campaign Management/Martech/AdTech solutions and help optimize our client’s marketing campaigns and operations. Individuals must have good communication skills, knowledge in relevant technologies, innovative thinking, and commitment to quality.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities:

Ideate and execute on compelling design workshops
Identify use cases and user journeys that can benefit from conversational experiences.
Own every stage of the conversation design process, from research and design to conversational scripting and QA.
Define NLP requirements and work with the AI/Discovery team to deliver solutions
Advise clients on industry best practices (when appropriate)
Accurately estimate time to complete work
Continually experiment with new tools and technologies
Ability to research and provide strategic, goal-driven solutions for clients
Collaborate with other designers, both offshore & onshore, including Co product managers, developers, UX designers and other stakeholders across the organization.
Provide useful contributions to team meetings and conversations, actively participating in client meetings and workshops- Ability to create hypothesis based on understanding of clients’ issues

Can work both autonomously and collaboratively with the team. As a designer, you will not only be expected to bring your own creative ideas to the table but also flawlessly execute on the shared project vision.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially when talking about design and collaborating with other team members. Has a strong digital and web vocabulary and can speak confidently to clients about web platforms, how designs will function and how designs will be implemented.

Excellent and efficient organizational and time management skills. Able to self-manage and prioritize tasks to ensure work is delivered on time and of the highest quality.

About the Venture
Solv Malaysia (the “Venture”) is a newly formed SCV-backed entity creating a digital Business to Business (“B2B”) e-commerce marketplace that will address growth challenges for the micro, small and medium sized businesses (“MSMEs”) in Malaysia while linking them to local and global supply chains.
The platform will help MSMEs grow their business by connecting verified buyers and sellers, facilitating them for quick and easy access to finance; as well as taking advantage of affordable and reliable business services to meet the pain points of the MSMEs in Malaysia.

About the role
The Business Planning Analyst for the Venture will assist all operations and ensure business processes are set up in a sustainable and agile way to support the Venture in all phases from product development, go-live, run and expansion. You will assist with providing business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution.
This is a rare opportunity for a self-driven, strong entrepreneurial spirit, start-up minded, solid and passionate leader to participate and contribute to a venture.
Responsibilities
Overall
Project planning, execution, follow ups
Interface with relevant stakeholders to overcome obstacles to implementation
Lead with the preparation and communication of high-quality and timely submissions of materials for the Venture to internal stakeholders and external clients
Assist in the budgeting and financial analysis for the Venture
Assist in managing various projects and initiatives and undertake ad hoc thematic work for the Venture Lead / CEO and the Operations Lead / COO
Assist in developing overall business strategies of the Venture
Set up governance cadence and assist with regular senior management and board meetings and ad hoc meetings including any follow up actions
Develop efficient business processes to support the growing business.
Take active lead regarding set-up of risk management framework, policies and standards
Perform any other tasks assigned by the Venture Lead / CEO and Operations Lead / COO
Stakeholder Management
Effectively engage Solv Malaysia and SCV stakeholders across functions
Strong communication skills, ability to tailor ideas to required audience and stakeholders
Possess a driven, can-do attitude and proactive in supporting stakeholder engagement
Comfortable in working with multiple stakeholders’ teams and functions
Build strong and effective relationships with the various technology and business counterparts
Some experience in co-ordination of multiple dependencies and stakeholders in complex, large scale deployment environments
People and Talent
Lead by example and assist in building the appropriate culture and values
Create a motivational and challenging environment in the team which is conducive to creativity and delivery of the strategy
Governance
Act and escalate quickly when any risk and control weakness become apparent and ensure they are addressed within an appropriate timeframe and escalated through the relevant committees
Work with multiple stakeholders to establish applicable risk / control framework to ensure that the Group’s ability to remain within risk appetite is not materially threatened
Familiarise self with governance structures and mandatory bank processes
Regulatory & Business Conduct
Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s as well as Solv’ Values and Code of Conduct
Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across SCB
Comply with all Compliance (AML, anti-fraud, anti-corruption etc.) requirements when performing duties
Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters
Key Stakeholders
Venture Lead / CEO
Solv Malaysia team members
Desired Experience, Knowledge & Skills
3+ years of experience
Experience working in corporates and ideally start-up environment
Strong project management, analytics, problem-solving, interpersonal and multi-tasking skills
Ability to learn quick and thrive in ambiguous environment
Excellent communication skills, both spoken and written
Experience of running large complex projects in a start-up environment is a plus
Being able to manage budgets in greenfield digital space
Personal integrity and proactive hand-on working attitude
Imaginative and creative approach to how we do work
Curiosity about new technologies, workflows, and products
Ability to see things from multiple perspectives, learn every day as well as continuously challenge the status quo of yourself, the team and the direction Solv Malaysia goes
Tireless work ethic and enthusiasm to execute and get things done
About SC Ventures
SC Ventures, part of Standard Chartered Bank (the “Bank”), is the platform and catalyst for innovation, investments in disruptive financial technology and exploration of alternative business models.
Our eXellerator enables us to facilitate innovation and culture change within the Bank and with our ecosystem partners; to change the way the Bank serves clients.
Our innovation investment fund enables our investment in validated fintech to develop future tech capabilities; integrating technology and capabilities into the Bank and ventures to drive speed and scale.
Our venture building stream explores new business models, with the objective of providing 'optionality' for the Group in the way it engages existing and new customers and markets.

Job_Description:
IT Projects Business Analysis
Oil & Gas Industry
Cyberjaya, Selangor
2 years Contract (until 31st Dec 2023)
Mon - Fri (8am - 5pm)
Projects Business Analysis is responsible for identifying and documenting the business needs of their clients and stakeholders, and helping to determine feasible solutions to meet business needs or resolve business problems.
This position will give you the opportunity to grow to become an active thought partner and solution visionary who shapes the technology demand and direction in the business community.
This position has the following accountabilities:
Precisely capture business concerns, value drivers, and functional/non-functional requirements, including health, safety, security, usability, data, and supportability considerations.
Translate business requirements into functionality and assess the risks - feasibility, opportunities, and business impacts of various solution options.
Assess and model processes, data flows, and technology to understand the current value and issues, and identify opportunities for improvement.
Create clear documentation to communicate requirements and related information; keep updated to align with the solution over the project lifecycle.
Ensure traceability of requirements from business needs and requirements, through testing and scope changes, to final solution.
Interact with software suppliers, designers and developers to understand software limitations, deliver elements of system and database design, and ensure that business requirements and use cases are handled
Configure and document software and processes, using agreed standards and tools.
Create acceptance criteria and validate those solutions meet business needs through defining and coordinating testing.
Create and present compelling business cases to justify solution value and establish approval, funding and prioritization.
Initiate, plan, execute, monitor, and control Business Analysis activities on projects within agreed parameters of cost, time and quality.
Understand and stay abreast of relevant architectures and technologies related to a business area. Research potential solutions and innovative ideas.
Guide and manage interactions with technology vendors.
Lead stakeholder management activities, including facilitation of large design sessions.
Special Challenges:
Respond to organizational and environmental changes during in-progress activities.
Guide business stakeholders to gain acceptance / sign-off despite competing objectives. Manage requirements to the smallest set that will provide the biggest impact in advancing business objectives and end-user buy-in.
Describe technology in terms easily understood by business customers and set realistic customer expectations for the project outcome. Adjust customer expectations in accordance with changes in scope.
Generate innovative approaches to existing problems or new opportunities.
Work closely with stakeholders to build trust and understand their goals,motivations, constraints, risks, and operating environment
Skills & Requirements: -
Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or IT
Agile project experience
Good understanding and experience of the various Agile frameworks
Experience working in Agile projects and educating stakeholders including Product Owners and Business partners in Agile ways of working
Experience in Agile tooling (ex -VSTS) is a must.
Agile certifications/trainings preferred
Understanding of systems engineering concepts and data/process analysis and modelling.
Knowledge of the technology landscape, including current and future developments and the most commonly available products and integrated solutions.
Ability to take a systematic and analytical approach to problem-solving and pay close attention to detail.
Experience analysing the alignment between business requirements and system capabilities.
Strong interpersonal and influencing skills.
Ability to communicate concisely and clearly.

Job Title
Upstream Energy Transition Company Research Analyst
Location
Kuala Lumpur
Job Type
Full Time
Your role
Are you a passionate researcher? Do you enjoy uncovering details to build compelling insights?
We are looking for a research analyst to join our Upstream Transformation Service team, focused on generating insights to help oil and gas companies, governments and financial investors to make critical decisions in an emerging low-carbon world. We are seeking a highly-motivated individual to:
Monitor how oil and gas companies adapt their upstream and corporate strategies to embrace the energy transition
Assess oil and gas companies’ commitments and performance in New Energies
Track and assess pure-player companies (clean tech, utilities, biofuels etc.) strategies to identify best practices and valuable learnings for the oil and gas companies targeting these sectors.
Research emerging energy transition developments affecting upstream oil and gas to support content generation
Monitor, collate and uniformise event information to support dataset development
Identify trends from the collected information and datasets, assist in generating insights on the transformation of upstream players
Collaborate with other analysts to draft insights on the companies’ initiatives in New Energies; as well as writing individual pieces of research on these topics.
Your team
You will be working in the Upstream Transformation team, which is focused on helping upstream stakeholders identify trends for reducing, offsetting and sequestering greenhouse gas emissions from core upstream oil and gas operations, benchmarking their actions, and defining emerging best practices in emissions management for companies and governments. The team is dedicated to providing critical information for oil and gas companies to navigate through the fast-changing and uncertain journey of the energy transition, helping the upstream stakeholders in portfolio choices and innovation beyond their traditional capabilities.
Your expertise
You have
Strong demonstrable research, qualitative and quantitative analysis, and critical thinking skills
Excellent written communication skills in English
Proficiency with MS applications (Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
Knowledge of the energy and upstream sectors would be beneficial
Ideally, having passed the Chartered Financial Analyst levels
You are
Curious and a fast learner who is excited to delve into new areas
Able to summarise and describe complex issues clearly and concisely
Able to manage multiple tasks and deadlines
Able to collaborate with a range of colleagues globally
Highly organized
Have great attention to detail
Your Benefits
Work with an international team to develop insightful research
Build your understanding of the upstream sector and the energy transition - an emerging trend that is shaping the entire energy industry
Join an industry-leading insight company
Flexible Working
We pride ourselves on our agility and diversity, and we welcome requests to work flexibly. For most roles, flexible hours and/or an element of remote working are usually possible. Please talk to us at interview about the type of arrangement that is best for you. We will always try to be adaptable wherever we can.
Return to Work
Have you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return to Work initiative (link to career site page when available), we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace.
Your colleagues
About us
We are over 14,000 analysts, data scientists and specialists armed with real-time technology and data, working together to uncover deeper sources of information. The unique insights we provide help the industries and markets that drive our economies operate more efficiently, outpace competition and secure long-term success. Our global insights impact nearly every major business sector - from aerospace to automotive. We empower our customers by isolating cause and effect, risk and opportunity in new ways so they can make well-informed decisions with greater confidence. This is a force we call The New Intelligence.
Join us
Boundaries belong on maps, not in your work. Start every day at IHS Markit with the excitement of what’s next, by working with people from across the globe on interesting, cutting-edge projects and gaining once-in-a-lifetime learning experiences. It is easy to be passionate and invested in your work here, knowing you are causing an effect for some of the world’s most influential companies. You’ll get to be hands-on with, and see the direct impact, of your work. Career satisfaction just comes with the territory here.

About Accenture
Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centres. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.
About Capability Network:
Part of Strategy & Consulting, the Capability Network is a global distributed management consulting organization that provides management consulting and strategy expertise across the client lifecycle. Approximately 3,600 consultants are part of this rapidly expanding network, providing specialized and strategic industry and functional consulting expertise from key locations around the world. Our Capability Network teams complement Accenture’s in-country teams to deliver cutting-edge expertise and measurable value to clients all around the world. For more information, visit www.accenture.com/capabilitynetwork.
Practice Overview:
The Customer Sales & Service functional team is aligned to the Capability Network division of Accenture and works with clients across its marketing, sales, and services department. The team provides transformation services across three key offerings: Marketing Transformation, Connected Commerce and Next-Generation Customer Care. These services help our clients become living businesses by optimizing their marketing and sales strategies and thereby optimizing their cost to serve, thus improving revenue per customer.
The team is comprised of individuals who have an in-depth understanding of marketing, sales and services functions and experience across various industries like Communications and High Tech, Banking, Insurance, Energy, Utilities and Retail.
We are looking for passionate and driven individuals who will help define marketing and campaign strategies, design and implement Campaign Management/Martech/AdTech solutions and help optimize our client’s marketing campaigns and operations. Individuals must have good communication skills, knowledge in relevant technologies, innovative thinking, and commitment to quality.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
Would be responsible for delivery of design and delivery in Customer Services domain including
Ideate and execute on compelling design workshops
Identify use cases and user journeys that can benefit from conversational experiences.
Own every stage of the conversation design process, from research and design to conversational scripting and QA.
Define NLP requirements and work with the AI/Discovery team to deliver solutions
Advise clients on industry best practices (when appropriate)
Accurately estimate time to complete work
Continually experiment with new tools and technologies
Ability to research and provide strategic, goal-driven solutions for clients
Collaborate with other designers, both offshore & onshore, including Co product managers, developers, UX designers and other stakeholders across the organization.
Provide useful contributions to team meetings and conversations, actively participating in client meetings and workshops- Ability to create hypothesis based on understanding of clients’ issues

Required Experience:
5+ years digital experience. Solid knowledge of industry tools and understanding of designing intuitive and responsive user experiences.
Experience developing interaction models using conversational platforms
Deep understanding of user-centered design processes
Strong visual design aesthetic and conceptual thinking. Strong handle of layout, navigation, typography, colors, and image composition as applied to web and mobile experiences. Maintains a meticulous attention to detail in all deliverables
Can work both autonomously and collaboratively with the team. As a designer, you will not only be expected to bring your own creative ideas to the table but also flawlessly execute on the shared project vision.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially when talking about design and collaborating with other team members. Has a strong digital and web vocabulary and can speak confidently to clients about web platforms, how designs will function and how designs will be implemented.
Comfortable working efficiently in the Botmock, Visio, Adobe HD and Figma. Dev ops knowledge is a bonus. Working knowledge of HTML/CSS preferred but not mandatory
Excellent and efficient organizational and time management skills. Able to self-manage and prioritize tasks to ensure work is delivered on time and of the highest quality.

Job Title
Analyst, Business Surveillance
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
RBC Wealth Management has provided trusted advice and wealth management solutions to individuals, families and institutions globally with a full suite of banking, investment, trust, asset management and other wealth management solutions. The team in Malaysia is responsible for ensuring execution excellence in supporting Wealth Management Operations (International and Asia), while continually evolving and driving operational effectiveness in support of the business growth strategy.
This role involves activity within the Client Due Diligence Team to support the business risk framework through a full review of front office sales & advisory and order taking processes. The team conducts surveillance on investment suitability, anti-fraud and other control reviews; as well as performing independent transaction review and testing.
This role will support Singapore and Hong Kong with working hours between 9AM and 6PM.
What will you do?
Perform independent transaction review and testing, including voice log listening of trades and customer instructions and conduct surveillance on investment suitability, anti-fraud and other control reviews.
Escalate non-compliance findings to stakeholders and follow up on remediation to ensure proper closure.
Provide advice to the Front Office on key controls relating to investment suitability, anti-fraud and related domains.
Support independent control activities, including witness call-back process, best execution, account reactivation, static data changes and other required disclosures to customers.
Maintain consistency with global policy and regulatory standards and actively address control aspects to ensure good business management is in place.
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
Tertiary education in Finance and Business.
Fluent in using Microsoft applications (Excel, Word, Outlook, etc.)
Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
Demonstrated attention to detail coupled with good problem solving skills; analytical and numeric reasoning skills.
Good spoken and written English and Mandarin is a must.
Nice-to-have
Knowledge in MAS/SFC/HKMA regulatory requirements.
Experience in managing multiple competing deadlines and manual processes in a fast pace environment.
A growth mindset and always strive for excellence.
Cantonese speaker.
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including performance based bonuses, flexible benefits, and competitive compensation
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
A world-class training program in financial services
A collaborative dynamic culture where personal initiative and hard work are recognized and rewarded
Job Summary

The team conducts surveillance on investment suitability, anti-fraud and other control reviews; as well as performing independent transaction review and testing.

About Us
Bjak is focused on providing access to affordable and sustainable financial services for people in Asia. Headquartered in Malaysia, Bjak is the largest insurance portal in Southeast Asia. Our main portal, Bjak.com, helps millions find the insurance policy with the best value and highest coverage for them. Our investments in technology such as Custom API, blockchain, trading systems and data science is to enable easy access to financial services that were previously inaccessible or difficult to understand.
Our core strengths are in navigating the most complex regulations and environments, creating some of the most innovative products in the world. For instance, we are the first platform globally to simplify and offer investment-linked life and health insurance online, coupled with an instant talk-to-agent service.

Description

Primary Objective:

Conduct detailed equity research in order to provide long-term investment and short-term trading ideas to Institutional Equities and Retail Securities sales teams, and effectively support Group Investment Banking efforts to generate revenue.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Meet requests from Institutional Equities sales teams and clients, and provide strong research support to Group Wholesale Banking and Group Investment Banking revenue pillars.
2. Cover sectors in the home country, as assigned:
Active monitoring of the micro and macro factors affecting the sector(s).
Regularly visit companies and organisations related to the sector(s).
Generate investment ideas on sectors/stocks including identifying sales/trading opportunities.
Write research reports on these investment ideas in a timely manner.
Consistently update Institutional clients on the latest development in the sector(s).
Assist in production/coordination of research publications and organisation of conferences.
3. Accompany a Head of Research or Head, Regional Sector in marketing roadshows and other client servicing efforts in the home country as well as overseas markets, as assigned.

4. Research Analysts, subject to performance, may be given an enlarged role with additional responsibilities to:
Cover companies outside of the home country as part of a regional sector team.
Participate, and potentially take a leading role, in a multi-sector thematic research project that includes other research analysts in the team.
5. All analysts must:
Display teamwork to achieve a coherent research product.
Work closely with other Board Members and other senior management personnel at all times to develop RHB’s research product and brand.
Ensure compliance of all legal and regulatory requirements to achieve a high standard of integrity for RHB’s research team and product.

Key Shared Accountabilities
Assist RHB Investment Bank in evaluation potential initial public offerings and corporate deals.
Collaborate with related departments in Group Investment Banking, including ECM, Corporate Finance, and Corporate Client Coverage teams.
Support and collaborate with Group Research departments, including Economic Research and Fixed Income, Currencies and Rates Research.

Requirements
Requirements:
Bachelor Degree - Finance-related degree.

Investment Advisor licence or similar, issued by local securities regulatory authoritiesMBA or CFA (preferred)

Min. of 1 year of research experience in an established financial institution
Strong ability to write and present fluently in English
Ability to use MS Word, Excel and Powerpoint
Industry experience would be an advantage

IT Projects Business Analysis

Projects Business Analysis is responsible for identifying and documenting the business needs of their clients and stakeholders, and helping to determine feasible solutions to meet business needs or resolve business problems.
This position will give you the opportunity to grow to become an active thought partner and solution visionary who shapes the technology demand and direction in the business community.
This position has the following accountabilities:
Precisely capture business concerns, value drivers, and functional/non-functional requirements, including health, safety, security, usability, data, and supportability considerations.
Translate business requirements into functionality and assess the risks - feasibility, opportunities, and business impacts of various solution options.
Assess and model processes, data flows, and technology to understand the current value and issues, and identify opportunities for improvement.
Create clear documentation to communicate requirements and related information; keep updated to align with the solution over the project lifecycle.
Ensure traceability of requirements from business needs and requirements, through testing and scope changes, to final solution.
Interact with software suppliers, designers and developers to understand software limitations, deliver elements of system and database design, and ensure that business requirements and use cases are handled
Configure and document software and processes, using agreed standards and tools.
Create acceptance criteria and validate those solutions meet business needs through defining and coordinating testing.
Create and present compelling business cases to justify solution value and establish approval, funding and prioritization.
Initiate, plan, execute, monitor, and control Business Analysis activities on projects within agreed parameters of cost, time and quality.
Understand and stay abreast of relevant architectures and technologies related to a business area. Research potential solutions and innovative ideas.
Guide and manage interactions with technology vendors.
Lead stakeholder management activities, including facilitation of large design sessions.
Special Challenges:
Respond to organizational and environmental changes during in-progress activities.
Guide business stakeholders to gain acceptance / sign-off despite competing objectives. Manage requirements to the smallest set that will provide the biggest impact in advancing business objectives and end-user buy-in.
Describe technology in terms easily understood by business customers and set realistic customer expectations for the project outcome. Adjust customer expectations in accordance with changes in scope.
Generate innovative approaches to existing problems or new opportunities.
Work closely with stakeholders to build trust and understand their goals,motivations, constraints, risks, and operating environment
Skills & Requirements: -
Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or IT
Agile project experience
Good understanding and experience of the various Agile frameworks
Experience working in Agile projects and educating stakeholders including Product Owners and Business partners in Agile ways of working
Experience in Agile tooling (ex -VSTS) is a must.
Agile certifications/trainings preferred
Understanding of systems engineering concepts and data/process analysis and modelling.
Knowledge of the technology landscape, including current and future developments and the most commonly available products and integrated solutions.
Ability to take a systematic and analytical approach to problem-solving and pay close attention to detail.
Experience analysing the alignment between business requirements and system capabilities.
Strong interpersonal and influencing skills.
Ability to communicate concisely and clearly.

Your role
As a Data Analyst at Deriv, you will provide insights by collecting, processing, analysing, and presenting data in a usable way. You will ensure data integrity and use data-driven techniques to acquire information to help draft business strategies. Your keen eye for detail and expertise in data analysis will be vital in converting data into actionable insights to solve complex business challenges.
Your challenges
Analyse business requirements and create a seamless data flow from the source.
Maintain data integrity, identify and resolve data gaps, convert data for analysis purposes, and create business terminologies for the users.
Work with other departments to recognise and understand the scope of potential problems and check the availability of relevant data to resolve them.
Provide reporting and analysis solutions in the form of dashboards or alerts, and present them to stakeholders.
Use data governance tools for data management and look for trends that can be helpful to make business decisions.
What you have
In-depth experience with reporting packages, SQL, programming (Python/R), and ETL frameworks for data wrangling purposes
Skills in data visualisation tools such as Tableau and Google Data Studio
Analytical skills with the ability to transform data into optimal business decisions
Solid background in statistics, mathematics, or engineering
Strong communication and presentation skills
Fluency in spoken and written English
What’s good to have
Experience with Google Cloud Services (GCS) such as Google Cloud Storage (GCs) and BigQuery
Quality experience in relational SQL, preferably with PostgreSQL
Understanding the marketing domain of financial products and services
Proficiency in using spreadsheet/Excel

Market-based salary
Annual performance bonus
Health benefits

Travel and internet allowances

We’re Deriv. We’re all about trading. We’re the geeky upstarts who pioneered an industry. That was more than 20 years ago, and we’re still going strong. Today, we work across continents and serve over a million traders from around the globe.
Join us. Grow with us.
Our team
We are the Business Intelligence team. We lead the organisation in cultivating a data-driven culture as our company moves towards the future. We collect meaningful data and analytics for us to deeply understand our clients and build more valuable products and services. What we do is incredibly important in driving smart marketing decisions, optimising our business, and increasing profitability.

Do you want to work with passionate teams, providing excellent business and digital services to the Asia Pacific region?
